body:
On Windows 10 is it still the case that without this call time.Sleep(time.Nanosecond) sleeps for 15 ms?

Operating systems have been moving to so-called high-precision timers that can sleep for smaller amounts of time even if the system clock is set to a relatively high period. Obviously it's not going to do 1ns, but I wouldn't be surprised if it were well under 1ms.
